page.title: 15Our part of Ellesmere R.P.C.
page.content: Since the infamous Poor Laws and the formation of Poor Law Unions, our area has been part of a ring shaped parish extending around Ellesmere. Ellesmere Rural Parish Council has 12 members and meets every month in Ellesmere town hall. The parish is divided into 5 wards - Frankton, Tetchill, Lyneal, Criftins and Duddleston Heath with the first two forming part of our area. The role of the parish council is essentially that of a pressure group. They make representations to the NSDC and their planners at Wem, although some feel that communications between parish and district could be better. Nevertheless, it is felt that the parish council performs a vital role, fighting for the retention of services and the maintenance of roads in a time of economic stringency.
